Sentece: Mean maximum increases in the QTc interval following thioridazine (37.3+/-4.1 ms, P=0.023) and mesoridazine (46.6+/-7.4 ms, P=0.021) were similar and significantly greater than following placebo (12.9+/-8.1 ms).
Title: Comparison of the effects of thioridazine and mesoridazine on the QT interval in healthy adults after single oral doses.
Name: Mesoridazine

Sentece: In vitro studies with control liver microsomes, as well as with microsomes of rats treated chronically with fluoxetine show that the changes in the thioridazine pharmacokinetics may be attributed to the competitive (N-demethylation, Ki = 23 microM) and mixed inhibition (2- and 5-sulfoxidation, Ki = 60 microM and 34 microM, respectively) of thioridazine metabolism by fluoxetine, and to the adaptive changes produced by chronic administration of fluoxetine, as reflected by inhibition of N-demethylation and formation of sulforidazine.
Title: The influence of selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors (SSRIs) on the pharmacokinetics of thioridazine and its metabolites: in vivo and in vitro studies.
Name: Mesoridazine

Sentece: Sertraline seemed to have a tendency to decrease thioridazine concentration in vivo, though in vitro studies showed that - like fluoxetine - it competitively or via mixed mechanism inhibited the three metabolic pathways of thioridazine (Ki = 41 microM, 64 microM and 47 microM, respectively).
